title.narrative: Get in the Ring in Northern Benin

description.narrative: Like many other African countries, Benin faces the challenge of creating employment for its young population. Economic growth is impressive, but employment growth lags behind. As a result, the majority of young people have an income below the poverty level. Benin has a dynamic young population, eager to take the future into their own hands. However, they lacks the skills, experience, and contacts to set up a successful business.Get in the Ring aims at stimulating youth entrepreneurship by developing skills of young entrepreneurs to enhance their success in business. It stimulates an entrepreneurial culture among young women and men, a culture of seeing and seizing opportunities and not giving up easily. After previous editions in Cotonou, the 2021 Get in the Ring takes place in Parakou in northern Benin. The youth in the north of Benin face even greater challenges than in the south: more than 80% of the young working population is underemployed, education levels are relatively low and there are not many training facilities for young entrepreneurs. Feelings of abandonment make them vulnerable to radicalization and prone to ideas of extremists from neighboring countries (Nigeria, Burkina Faso, Niger). The project promotes entrepreneurship through training, a (pitching) competition, and a networking event, involving champions, potential investors and coaching companies. The project will coach twenty young entrepreneurs. The winner will participate in the global GITR competition. The GITR model fits into other NL-financed projects to stimulate youth entrepreneurship in Benin (such as Benibiz and EJASA-North Benin).
Business development, by investment or trade of local or Dutch companies with(in) low and middle income countries
